tetris
Class HighScore

java.lang.Object
  tetris.HighScore

public class HighScore
extends java.lang.Object

Handles online storage of high score data. The top 10 high scores, referenced by score, are stored in a Map, which is written and read between the client and server via ObjectIOStream.

NUMBER_OF_FINALISTS

public static final int NUMBER_OF_FINALISTS
See Also:
Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

HighScore

public HighScore()
Constructs a new HighScore. Attempts to read data from the server into the Map. If no file is found, a new Map and file are created.

HighScore

public HighScore(java.lang.String firstName,
                 int firstScore)
Constructs a new HighScore with the given data as the first and only initial Map entry. No data is read from the server, but the new data is written there. If a file previously existed, it is overwritten by the current data.

Parameters:
firstName - String to be put in the first MapEntry (name)
firstScore - Integer to be put in the first MapEntry (score)
Method Detail

addListingIfEligible

public boolean addListingIfEligible(java.lang.String contendent,
                                    int score)
Adds the given data to the map if the score qualifies as top ten.

Parameters:
contendent - Name of scorer
score - Score to be added if possible
Returns:
Whether or not the data was eligible.

save

public void save()
Writes the Map to the server.

getMinimumToQualify

public int getMinimumToQualify()
Determines the lowest score in the Map

Returns:
int representing lowest score.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
String representation of data in Map.

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
String representation as described above.
